page.title: 19Living in Bourne End
page.content: {A RETIRED LADY} This lady was much less concerned about the lack of facilities in the village.Her bungalow backed onto the river and canal which she enjoyed without having to worry about safety. Nor was she concerned about the traffic as she used a car rather than walk.The problem of traffic noise was overcome by double glazing although they did notice railway noise in the garden. The young mother was disturbed by the noise from the pubs etc.near her especially at closing time but the older lady was unconcerned as she lived farther away. Both people had to go by car to Hemel Hempstead to shop and felt that the amenity that was most lacking was a village shop that sold fresh bread,groceries,vegetables etc.
